Package zemeckis

Class Zemeckis

java.lang.Object
zemeckis.Zemeckis
@OmitClinit public final class Zemeckis extends Object
This class is the main entrypoint for the Zemeckis library. It provides the access to global configuration settings as well as methods for scheduling tasks asynchronously.

Zemeckis has an internal clock that represents time as a monotonically increasing int value. The value may or may not have a direct relationship to wall-clock time and the unit of the value is defined by the implementation.

The scheduler assigns tasks to different VirtualProcessorUnit (VPU) instances that run at different phases in the browser lifecycle. Tasks can be scheduled on the:

  • "Macro" task VPU. The normal phase where event callbacks, timer timeouts, message channel handlers etc. are invoked.
  • "Micro" task VPU. Invoked immediately after the current "Macro" or "Micro" task.
  • "animationFrame" VPU. Invoked prior to the next browser render.
  • "afterFrame" VPU. Invoked after the next browser render.
  • "onIdle" VPU. Invoked when the browser is idle.

    • areNamesEnabled

      public static boolean areNamesEnabled()
      Return true if user should pass names into API methods, false if should pass null.
      Returns:
      true if user should pass names into API methods, false if should pass null.

    • areUncaughtErrorHandlersEnabled

      public static boolean areUncaughtErrorHandlersEnabled()
      Return true if uncaught error handlers are enabled.
      Returns:
      true if uncaught error handlers are enabled, false otherwise.

    • useMessageChannelToScheduleTasks

      public static boolean useMessageChannelToScheduleTasks()
      Return true if message channels should be used to schedule tasks in the next macro task rather than setTimeout(..., 0).
      Returns:
      true if message channels should be used to schedule tasks over setTimeout, false otherwise.

    • useWorkerToScheduleDelayedTasks

      public static boolean useWorkerToScheduleDelayedTasks()
      Return true if delayed tasks should be scheduled in a worker rather than in the main thread. The worker is less likely to be throttled and suffers form less jitter.
      Returns:
      true if delayed tasks should be scheduled in a worker rather than in the main thread, false otherwise.

    • shouldLogWorkerInteractions

      public static boolean shouldLogWorkerInteractions()
      Return true if interactions with workers for scheduling delayed tasks should be logged. This is primarily useful when debugging problems with the library and is not expected to be widely used.
      Returns:
      true if interactions with workers for scheduling delayed tasks should be logged, false otherwise.

    • shouldCheckInvariants

      public static boolean shouldCheckInvariants()
      Return true if invariants will be checked.
      Returns:
      true if invariants will be checked.

      Returns:
      true if apiInvariants will be checked.

    • purgeTasksWhenRunawayDetected

      public static boolean purgeTasksWhenRunawayDetected()
      Return true if active tasks will be purged if the scheduler is still running after the maximum number of rounds.
      Returns:
      true if active tasks will be purged if the scheduler is still running after the maximum number of rounds.

    • addUncaughtErrorHandler

      public static void addUncaughtErrorHandler(@Nonnull UncaughtErrorHandler handler)
      Add error handler to the list of error handlers called. The handler should not already be in the list. This method should NOT be called if areUncaughtErrorHandlersEnabled() returns false.
      Parameters:
      handler - the error handler.

      Parameters:
      handler - the error handler.

    • delayedTask

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable delayedTask(@Nonnull Runnable task, int delay)
      Schedules the execution of the given task after a specified delay.
      Parameters:
      task - the task to execute.
      delay - the delay before the task should execute. Must be a value greater than 0.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • delayedTask

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable delayedTask(@Nullable String name, @Nonnull Runnable task, int delay)
      Schedules the execution of the given task after a specified delay.
      Parameters:
      name - A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if areNamesEnabled() returns true and null otherwise.
      task - the task to execute.
      delay - the delay before the task should execute. Must be a value greater than 0.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • periodicTask

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable periodicTask(@Nonnull Runnable task, int period)
      Schedules the periodic execution of the given task with specified period.
      Parameters:
      task - the task to execute.
      period - the period after execution when the task should be re-executed. Must be a value greater than 0.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • macroTask

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable macroTask(@Nonnull Runnable task)
      Queue the task to execute in the current or next "macro" task. This task is schedule via a setTimeout(callback,0) call or a send operation on a message channel depending on the value returned by useMessageChannelToScheduleTasks().
      Parameters:
      task - the task.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • macroTask

      Parameters:
      name - A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if areNamesEnabled() returns true and null otherwise.
      task - the task.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • microTask

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable microTask(@Nonnull Runnable task)
      Queue the task to execute in the current or next "micro" task. The "micro" tasks are those that the browser executes after the current "macro". This task is schedule via a call that looks like Promise.resolve().then( v -> callback() ).
      Parameters:
      task - the task.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • microTask

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable microTask(@Nullable String name, @Nonnull Runnable task)
      Queue the task to execute in the current or next "micro" task. The "micro" tasks are those that the browser executes after the current "macro". The specified task is scheduled via a call that looks like Promise.resolve().then( v -> callback() ).
      Parameters:
      name - A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if areNamesEnabled() returns true and null otherwise.
      task - the task.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • animationFrame

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable animationFrame(@Nonnull Runnable task)
      Queue the task to execute in the current or next "animationFrame". The "animationFrame" occurs prior to the next render frame. The specified task is scheduled via a call that looks like requestAnimationFrame( callback ).
      Parameters:
      task - the task.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • afterFrame

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable afterFrame(@Nonnull Runnable task)
      Queue the task to execute after the next browser render. The "afterFrame" tasks are invoked after the next frames render by responding to a message on a MessageChannel that is sent in a callback scheduled via requestAnimationFrame().
      Parameters:
      task - the task.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • afterFrame

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable afterFrame(@Nullable String name, @Nonnull Runnable task)
      Queue the task to execute after the next browser render. The "afterFrame" tasks are invoked after the next frames render by responding to a message on a MessageChannel that is sent in a callback scheduled via requestAnimationFrame().
      Parameters:
      name - A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if areNamesEnabled() returns true and null otherwise.
      task - the task.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

      Return the "afterFrame" VirtualProcessorUnit.
      Returns:
      the "afterFrame" VirtualProcessorUnit.
      See Also:
      • microTask(Runnable)

    • onIdle

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable onIdle(@Nonnull Runnable task)
      Queue the task to execute when the browser is idle. The browser activates the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit when idle and will pass the duration or deadline until which the VirtualProcessorUnit may run. The VirtualProcessorUnit will execute tasks scheduled via onIdle as long as there are tasks queued and the deadline has not been reached after which the VirtualProcessorUnit will return control to the browser. Unlike other scheduling strategies, when the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit completes the activation, there may still be tasks in the queue and if there is the VirtualProcessorUnit will re-schedule itself for another activation. The specified task is scheduled via a call that looks like requestIdleCallback( callback ).
      Parameters:
      task - the task.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

    • onIdle

      @Nonnull public static Cancelable onIdle(@Nullable String name, @Nonnull Runnable task)
      Queue the task to execute when the browser is idle. The browser activates the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit when idle and will pass the duration or deadline until which the VirtualProcessorUnit may run. The VirtualProcessorUnit will execute tasks scheduled via onIdle as long as there are tasks queued and the deadline has not been reached after which the VirtualProcessorUnit will return control to the browser. Unlike other scheduling strategies, when the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit completes the activation, there may still be tasks in the queue and if there is the VirtualProcessorUnit will re-schedule itself for another activation. The specified task is scheduled via a call that looks like requestIdleCallback( callback ).
      Parameters:
      name - A human consumable name for the task. It may be non-null if areNamesEnabled() returns true and null otherwise.
      task - the task.
      Returns:
      the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

      Returns:
